SENT.plain: OBJECTIVES: The value of transcranial Doppler (TCD) ultrasonography in assessing patients with Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension (IIH) is uncertain
We sought to determine the contribution of TCD to their evaluation
MATERIALS AND METHODS: Twenty-three patients with suspected IIH underwent TCD

Mean blood flow (BFV), peak systolic (PSV) and end-diastolic (EDV) velocities, and pulsatility (PI) and resistance (RI) indexes were obtained in the middle cerebral (MCA) and vertebral (VA) arteries and compared (Student's t-test) between patients with confirmed IIH and controls
IIH patients and controls were comparable in terms of age, gender and weight

RESULTS: The mean +/- SD BFV(MCA), PSV(MCA), EDV(MCA) and PI(VA) in the 13 IIH patients were higher than in the ten controls (59 +/- 6.8, 94 +/- 28.5, 43 +/- 12.4, 0.86 +/- 0.16 and 50 +/- 8.6, 72 +/- 25.8, 32 +/- 11.5, 0.58 +/- 0.45 respectively, P < 0.05) but still within normal values
The mean +/- SD PI(MCA), RI(MCA) and RI(VA) values in the IIH patients and controls were similar
CONCLUSIONS: TCD parameters had no useful unique features for monitoring IIH patients
